Detaching Labels

If you decide not to include certain items in a view or revision label, you can detach the label from those items individually or as a group. Generally, the items from which labels are detached are files or folders.

To detach a view or revision label from selected items:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Select the items that do not require the label.

  4. Select Labels > Detach from the component or context menu. This dialog lists all existing labels and identifies them as view or revision labels. By default, both the View labels and Revision labels check boxes are selected.

  5. To limit the list to a specific type of label, clear the appropriate check box.

  6. Select a label from the list.

  7. Click OK.

To detach a view or revision label from a specific item revision:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Select the item from the upper pane.

  4. Select the Label tab. This action displays the Label pane, which shows all revisions of the item.

  5. In the Label pane, double-click a revision to see all labels attached to it as children of the revision.

  6. Right-click the label you wish to remove. This action displays the Label context menu.

  7. Select Detach.

  8. Click OK.

To detach a view or revision label from a folder and its contents:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Select Labels from the Folder menu or context menu. The Labels dialog lists the labels currently attached to this folder.

  3. Select the label to be detached from the folder.

  4. Click Detach. The Detach Label dialog opens.

  5. (Optional) If you are detaching a revision label, select the Folder only, Folder and items contained In folder, or the Everything in subtree rooted at folder option button.

  6. Click OK.

    7. Note: When you detach a view label from a folder, the label is automatically detached from the items that the folder contains. It is also automatically detached from the folder’s child folders and their contents.
